title: SW PROFESSIONAL premium hair-care product showcase (frontend)

requirements.summary: Build a public landing page for “SW PROFESSIONAL” with clear brand positioning and navigation to product sections.
acceptanceCriteria: The app name “SW PROFESSIONAL” is displayed prominently in the header/hero.
The landing page includes short, readable English copy describing the 3 focus outcomes: reduced hair fall, smoother hair, stronger scalp & hair.
The landing page includes clear navigation to product sections (Shampoo, Hair Mask, Hair Serum).

file_operations.description: Create the public landing page structure (header + hero + positioning copy + navigation links that jump to the three product sections). Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button, Separator) for consistent premium UI elements; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure the document title/metadata aligns with “SW PROFESSIONAL” and supports a public landing experience (English-only).

Add a header/navigation component that prominently displays “SW PROFESSIONAL” and provides in-page navigation to Shampoo, Hair Mask, and Hair Serum sections. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button) for nav actions; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Implement a product browsing experience for three products with consistent cards and dedicated detail sections powered by backend-fetched catalog data.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can view a list/section of the 3 products on the main page.
Each product has a dedicated detail view/section that includes name, description, and benefits text in English.
UI uses a consistent structure across all three products (same fields and layout pattern).

file_operations.description: Create a React Query hook that uses the existing useActor hook to fetch the product catalog via the generated canister actor (getProducts / optionally getProductById) and exposes loading/error states for the UI.

Create a reusable product card component showing product image, name, short description, key benefits preview, and a CTA to jump to/open the dedicated detail section. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card, Button, Badge) to keep a consistent structure; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a dedicated detail section component per product (rendered from fetched data) including name, shortDescription, full benefits list, and a CTA area (e.g., “Learn more” / “How to use”) using an expandable pattern. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Accordion) for the expandable “How to use” content; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire product browsing into the landing page: fetch catalog using useProducts, render a 3-item product list, and render dedicated detail sections (with stable anchors/ids) for Shampoo, Hair Mask, and Hair Serum using the shared components. Use English-only text and keep layout consistent across products.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive premium cosmetic theme (non blue/purple dominant) across landing and product views.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent color palette and typography style are applied across header, hero, product cards/sections, and buttons.
Theme feels “premium cosmetic” (clean, spacious, high-contrast readability).

file_operations.description: Add global theme tokens/styles (Tailwind base + CSS variables if used) for a warm neutral premium palette (e.g., ivory/cream backgrounds, charcoal text, subtle gold/bronze accents) and typography defaults, ensuring no blue/purple-dominant primary colors.

Adjust/extend Tailwind theme configuration to support the premium cosmetic palette and spacing/typography choices used by the landing + product components, keeping primary styling away from blue/purple dominance.

Apply the theme consistently via Tailwind utility classes across header/hero/product sections (spacing, typography scale, button styles, card surfaces) to achieve a clean, premium cosmetic look. Use shadcn-ui components where appropriate to enforce consistent UI primitives; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add required generated images as static assets and render them in the header/hero and product visuals.
acceptanceCriteria: All generated images are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Landing/hero displays the hero banner image.
Header/brand area displays the logo image.
Each of the three products displays its corresponding product image.

file_operations.description: Add the generated hero banner image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/sw-professional-hero.dim_1600x900.png.
Add the generated logo image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/sw-professional-logo.dim_512x512.png.
Add the generated shampoo product image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/product-shampoo.dim_1024x1024.png.
Add the generated hair mask product image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/product-hair-mask.dim_1024x1024.png.
Add the generated hair serum product image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/product-hair-serum.dim_1024x1024.png.
Render the logo asset in the header/brand area by referencing frontend/public/assets/generated/sw-professional-logo.dim_512x512.png directly (static asset).

Render the hero banner image by referencing frontend/public/assets/generated/sw-professional-hero.dim_1600x900.png directly, and wire each product card/detail to display its corresponding product image (frontend/public/assets/generated/product-shampoo.dim_1024x1024.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/product-hair-mask.dim_1024x1024.png, frontend/public/assets/generated/product-hair-serum.dim_1024x1024.png).
